timeline.message: added intial place holders for versioning
Support for versioning
updated inference apis and worker scaling logic
adding getModel to hide version manager class
updated management apis and fixed predict api
added version support in model archive
added changes to describe model api
reverted unneccessary version change
Fixed issues
Merge branch 'versioning' of https://github.com/pytorch/serve into versioning
fixed model name
updated test mar files
changes for threads/worker naming

timeline.bodyText: remove dead code
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: this removes unregisterModel() is the impl for this coming in a future commit?
timeline.author: mycpuorg

timeline.bodyText: this removes support for updating models. is the impl for this coming in a future model?
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: it's worthwhile changing the method name to getDefaultModels() or something of the nature.
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText:
nice.
Does this propagate upwards to the HTTP req handler level?
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: We are still working on it.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: any particular reason this is public? We don't expect this to be a part of http req handling codebase do we?
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: It needs to be public as this is going to get called from ModelManager for removing versioned models
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: If we are adopting this method to compute a unique key for model and version combo then we should somehow propagate this info (perhaps through documentation in README) to the users.
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: Sure.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

replies.bodyText: What are the acceptable formats for model versions (and the default ones that we generate)? I can potentially see this being an issue as some common model names used are model_pathlength ie: resnet_18.
replies.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: @mycpuorg - The unique key created using name+version is internal to component and is not required to part of doc. @alexwong - Model version is non-negative double value and to be supplied by user via MAR utility
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: We probably need to check for clash of versions? What's to prevent user from entering 100 model archives with the same version?
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: since we are not overloading here, let's force them to send a valid version ID by throwing exception in else-block.
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: This is to handle scenarios where the user has not supplied model number and default should be executed such as /models/<name_of_model> or /predictions/<model_name>
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: not sure if this convention is followed in Java of using '_' ahead of a privately used function in a class? I don't see any other practice/convention used in this project.
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: In java, the identifier does not begin with '_'.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: indentation looks a little off here ??
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: The indentation is per Gradle java code format command fJ which is using google java coding style.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: Is this a new response we are sending or has it been around? Does the client know or care about what this health status is? Why not send, 500 with a hint about 'scaling'
timeline.author: mycpuorg

replies.bodyText: This has been ported as-is from MMS. It is overall status.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.message: added check to re-add default version on unregister failure
fixed pmd issues
fixed muliple model version registration logic
updated error message while unregistering default model version
added new api to change model version
incorporated code review comments and updated UT
Add dockerfile
enhanced describe api to describe all model vesrions
generalised existing test cases
added describe api UTs
fixed model name in UT
added more test cases for versioned apis
added UT for versioned scaling up of model and negative test case to unregister default version
fixed UTs
added missed mar file
adding benchmark scripts
commented test case for unregister default version
changed expected type to array
pmd and formatting fixes
Updated docs for versioning related apis and replaced TS with TorchServe
updated java installation steps for mac to use openjdk
updated model url

timeline.bodyText: segments[3].equals("predict")
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: This as per PMD standards and it also protects us from NULL point exception.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: segments[2].equals("predict")
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: This as per PMD standards and it also protects us from NULL point exception.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: Remove or add comment describing what this is for.
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: Removed commented code.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: I've been seeing a lot of checking of strings and stuff for segments which has I guess model name and model version. Would it be better to make it a class so we can directly check if a field is not null rather than checking length each time?
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: This is per existing framework however as you have suggested the same can be improved.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: segments[4].equals("set-default")
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: This as per PMD standards and it also protects us from NULL point exception.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: Why contentEquals vs equals?
timeline.author: alexwong
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -84,7 +92,8 @@ protected void handleRequest(
 
     private boolean isManagementReq(String[] segments) {
         return segments.length == 0
-                || ((segments.length == 2 || segments.length == 3) && segments[1].equals("models"))
+                || ((segments.length >= 2 && segments.length <= 4) && segments[1].equals("models"))
+                || (segments.length == 5 && segments[4].contentEquals("set-default"))

replies.bodyText: Changed to equals.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: modelVersion.equals("all")
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: This is as per PMD. This also helps to avoid null pointer exception.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: Still reading all of the code. But here we check for both model and model version (more strict) but throw a generic modelnotfound exception. If we're checking for model version, I think we should throw some versionnotfound exception (still reading through code so this may not exist in this PR) and only throw modelnotfound if the model was never registered (ie: no versions exist at all).
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: harshbafna

timeline.bodyText: Can unregister model handle modelVersion == null? I can see it being useful to not have to provide a version when unregistering.
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: With null version, it will try to remove default however as per our logic, we don't allow default model deletion unless it is the only version available with TorchServe
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: Where does 25 length restriction come from? We should document this somewhere.
timeline.author: alexwong
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -117,8 +117,10 @@ public void startWorker(int port) throws WorkerInitializationException, Interrup
                         "W-"
                                 + port
                                 + '-'
-                                + model.getModelName()
-                                        .substring(0, Math.min(model.getModelName().length(), 25));
+                                + model.getModelVersionName()
+                                        .substring(
+                                                0,
+                                                Math.min(model.getModelVersionName().length(), 25));

replies.bodyText: Ported as is from MMS. We will have to discuss this.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: harshbafna

timeline.bodyText: I'm assuming modelversionname = old_model_name + version. Could cause problems is user passes in a long model name.
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: See earlier comment for name length
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: harshbafna

timeline.bodyText: Why are the eager and ts tests removed?
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: These test cases have not been removed rather we have generalized the testLoadModel method to include these. This is to take care of code repetition
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

timeline.bodyText: Why are these removed?
timeline.author: alexwong

replies.bodyText: Same comment as earlier for test case removal.
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar

Changes for review comments

Add example Dockerfile
